about.summary: This is a two-in-one package which provides interfaces to both R and Python. It implements fast hierarchical, agglomerative clustering routines. Part of the functionality is designed as drop-in replacement for existing routines: linkage() in the SciPy package 'scipy.cluster.hierarchy', hclust() in R's 'stats' package, and the 'flashClust' package. It provides the same functionality with the benefit of a much faster implementation. Moreover, there are memory-saving routines for clustering of vector data, which go beyond what the existing packages provide. For information on how to install the Python files, see the file INSTALL in the source distribution.

name: r-fastcluster
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.1.25" %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-fastcluster
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: fastcluster_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/fastcluster_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - https://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/Archive/fastcluster/fastcluster_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: f3661def975802f3dd3cec5b2a1379f3707eacff945cf448e33aec0da1ed4205

build:
  merge_build_host: true  # [win]
  number: 1003
  script: R CMD INSTALL --build .
  skip: true  # [win32]
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - posix                # [win]
    - {{ compiler('fortran') }}        # [unix]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_fortran') }}  # [win]
    - {{ compiler('c') }}        # [unix]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}  # [win]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}        # [unix]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_cxx') }}  # [win]
  host:
    - r-base

  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('fastcluster')"  # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('fastcluster')\""  # [win]
    - conda inspect linkages -p $PREFIX r-fastcluster  # [not win]
    - conda inspect objects -p $PREFIX r-fastcluster  # [osx]

about:
  home: http://danifold.net/fastcluster.html
  license: BSD-2-Clause-FreeBSD OR GPL-2.0-only
  summary: "This is a two-in-one package which provides interfaces to both R and Python. It implements fast hierarchical, agglomerative clustering routines. Part of the functionality is designed as drop-in replacement for existing routines: linkage() in the SciPy package 'scipy.cluster.hierarchy', hclust() in R's 'stats'\
    \ package, and the 'flashClust' package. It provides the same functionality with the benefit of a much faster implementation. Moreover, there are memory-saving routines for clustering of vector data, which go beyond what the existing packages provide. For information on how to install the Python files, see the file INSTALL\
    \ in the source distribution."
  license_family: GPL2

  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2
    - LICENSE
extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - dpryan79
    - jsignell
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
